title: How to Make a PVC Pet Bed

steps.title: Get your PVC pieces all together.
steps.content: Get your PVC pieces all together. You can use a smaller size (3/4 inch is used here), but it won't be as strong.

steps.title: Start assembling them.
steps.content: Start assembling them. Be sure that the feet are headed in the same direction and the shape is as squared as you can get it. It is very easy to get turned around. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Wash any new fabric.
steps.content: Wash any new fabric. If your cloth that you will be using is new, wash it. [2] X Research source You want it to shrink somewhat (like it would naturally) before you affix it to the frame. If you are going to be making a quilted bed, do what you need to, to get it ready. The soft part of this setup is a small velour blanket folded into quarters.

steps.title: Take the larger sheet of material and wrap it around the sides of the bed.
steps.content: Take the larger sheet of material and wrap it around the sides of the bed. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Find some way of fastening them.
steps.content: Find some way of fastening them. You could use rivets, snaps, hooks, even hook-and-loop fastener. Keep in mind that you are going to have to clean it periodically. [4] X Research source A particularly easy method is to sew the material around the sides, but you won't be able to glue the legs to the corner ends, completely.

steps.title: Be proud of your finished results.
steps.content: Be proud of your finished results.
